content:
• Tuesday, February 27, 2018
  • AABA

    Altaba to pursue open sales of Yahoo Japan, but likely will mull other options

    • As expected, Altaba (NASDAQ:AABA) is "moving to an active monetization mode" on its stake in Yahoo Japan (OTCPK:YAHOY), its CEO confirmed on a conference call.
    • And that will come through open market sales in the April-June time frame: the "only option immediately available to us," Thomas McInerney said.
    • He didn't rule out other possibilities, though: "But certainly I would personally be disappointed if we didn’t find a more efficient path.”
    • The company's got options, says Morgan Stanley analyst Testuro Tsusaka, which could include selling to Yahoo Japan and SoftBank (OTCPK:SFTBY), and Altaba's likely to find the one that isn't disruptive to those two companies.
    • SoftBank's likely to push for a Yahoo Japan repurchase, since it might be cautious with a major new shareholder that might be disruptive, Tsusaka says.
    • In market moves today: AABA -2.5%; OTCPK:YAHOY -4.3%; OTCPK:SFTBY -2.2%.
    • Source: Bloomberg
     
     
     
     
    | 7:32 PM | 46 Comments
  • AAXN

    Axon Enterprises +16% after big Q4 beat, upside 2018 revenue guidance

    • Axon Enterprises (NASDAQ:AAXN) +16.4% after-hours as it reports Q4 earnings and revenues that easily beat expectations and announces expected 16%-18% growth in revenues for 2018.
    • AAXN says Q4 2017 bookings came in at $71.2M while future contracted revenue rose to $536M from $494M in Q3, and annual bookings jumped 15% Y/Y to $291 from $254M in 2016.
    • The company says Q1 2018 is off to a strong start for new orders, including its second largest body camera deployment of 11K to Australia's Victoria Police backed by Evidence.com.
    • AAXN also issues upside guidance for FY 2018, seeing revenues of $399M-$406M vs. $39$M analyst consensus estimate.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:09 PM | 4 Comments
  • EOG

    EOG Resources -4% as 2018 capex growth surges to $5.4B-$5.8B

    • EOG Resources (NYSE:EOG) -4.6% after-hours despite reporting better than expected Q4 earnings and revenues, as expected 2018 production increases fail to keep pace with the rate of growth in planned capital spending.
    • EOG says crude oil and condensate volumes in the U.S. rose 20% in 2017 to 335K bbl/day, and targets 18% crude oil production growth and 16% total production growth for 2018.
    • However, EOG plans 2018 capex of $5.4B-$5.8B after spending $4.44B in 2017.
    • At year-end 2017, total company net proved reserves were 2.527B boe, up 18% Y/Y, with additions from all sources replacing 201% of 2017 production.
    • EOG also raises its quarterly cash dividend by 10.4% to $0.185/share.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:30 PM | 27 Comments
  • RRC

    Range Resources +6% on strong Q4 results, 2018 production growth outlook

    • Range Resources (NYSE:RRC) +6.4% after-hours following a comfortable Q4 earnings beat and revenues soar 168% Y/Y to $679M from $253M in the year-ago quarter.
    • RRC says Q4 production averaged 2.17B cfe/day, up 17% Y/Y, and expects Q1 production of 2.18B cfe/day.
    • Q4 natural gas, NGLs and oil price realizations averaged $3.01/Mcfe, up 6% from the prior-year quarter.
    • RRC says its 2018 capital budget is $941M, with 85% allocated to the Appalachia division and 15% to the North Louisiana division; the company expects production of 2.23B cfe/day in 2018, up 11% Y/Y.
    • In its five-year outlook, RRC also sees production growth of ~11%/year while generating more than $1B in cumulative free cash flow.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:58 PM | 18 Comments
  • PHH

    After Hours Gainers / Losers (2/27/2018)

    • Top gainers: PHH +24.4%. AAXN +15.6%. TIVO +12.1%. OCN +11.3%. BKNG +7.0%.
    • Top losers: FTR -13.9%. BGS -12.0%. TSRO -10.6%. CELG -7.7%. ACAD -7.3%.

  • SQ

    Square expects to almost double its earnings in 2018 guidance

    • Q4 gross payment volume up 31% Y/Y to $17.9B. Adjusted revenue up 47% to $283M, and adjusted EBITDA up 38% to $41M.
    • 2018 guidance is as follows: Adjusted revenue is expected to be  $1.3B-$1.33B vs. $984M last year. Adjusted EBITDA raised to $240M-250M vs $139M last year. Margin is expected to be 19% vs 14% last year. Adjusted EPS is expected to be $0.43 - $0.47 vs $0.27 last year.
    • Cash App now has more than 7M monthly active customers as of December 2017.
    • Shareholder Letter
    • Previously: Square beats by $0.01, beats on revenue (Feb. 27)
    • [[SQ]] down 2% after hours
     
     
     
     
    | 5:33 PM | 38 Comments
  • ATUS

    Altice USA +2.8% as Q4 shows steady revenue gains

    • Altice USA (NYSE:ATUS) is up 2.8% postmarket after posting Q4 earnings where revenues ticked up nearly 3% and it guided for more of the same in 2018.
    • Net income came to $2.25B, incorporating a tax benefit of $2.42B.
    • EBITDA was up 11.7% to $1.04B, light of consensus for $1.057B.
    • The company saw residential broadband net adds of 25,000 (vs. year-ago +36,000), net losses in Pay TV RGUs of 25,000 (vs. year-ago -21,000), and telephony net adds of 10,000 (vs. year-ago -4,000).
    • Business services revenue rose 5.5% driven by SMB revenues that rose 7.5%.
    • For 2018, it's guiding to revenue growth of 2.5%-3%, and to increase investment (in Altice One, fiber-to-the-home deployment and new MVNO investment) keeping with annual capex of around $1.3B. It still expects to expand EBITDA and cash flow margins in the medium to long term.
    • Earnings call slides
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 5:28 PM | 2 Comments
  • OCN

    Ocwen buying PHH Corp. for $360M; shares up 11%

    • The regulatory worm has apparently turned for Ocwen Financial (NYSE:OCN), which announces a deal to buy PHH Corp. (NYSE:PHH) for $360M in cash, or $11 per share.
    • The combined company will service 1.9B loans with a UPB of $328B. That would begin to resemble the sort of scale that was kind of reason many were wildly bullish on Ocwen forty points ago.
    • It's expected that $260M of the necessary funding will come from cash on PHH's balance sheet, and Ocwen will assume $119M of PHH's debt.
    • Closing is expected in H2.
    • A conference call is set for tomorrow at 8:30 ET.
    • Source: Press Release
    • Ocwen +11.6% after hours, and PHH +24.4% to $10.60.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:27 PM | 6 Comments
  • CELG

    Celgene -8% after FDA turns away multiple sclerosis drug application

    • Celgene (NASDAQ:CELG) -7.8% after-hours on news the U.S. Food and Drug Administration rejected its new drug application for a multiple sclerosis treatment, a surprise that likely will delay the entry of one of its most important pipeline assets.
    • CELG says it received a "refusal to file" letter from the FDA for the company's drug ozanimod for the treatment of patients with relapsing multiple sclerosis because of insufficient data.
    • CELG says it will "seek immediate guidance, including requesting a Type A meeting with the FDA, to ascertain what additional information will be required to resubmit the NDA."
     
     
     
     
    | 5:19 PM | 104 Comments
  • I

    Intelsat jumps 28% as FCC's Pai hints at monetizing C-band

    • Intelsat (NYSE:I) vaulted higher in the last 90 minutes of trading to close up 28.4%, riding comments FCC Chairman Ajit Pai made at Mobile World Congress in Barcelona.
    • Pai plans to "propose the next steps needed to make the 3.7 to 4.2 GHz band available for commercial terrestrial use," he said.
    • Earlier this month, Intelsat noted SES (OTCPK:SGBAF) was joining its proposal (also backed by Intel) to share spectrum in C-band while reserving some of those airwaves for other wireless operators, in a plan to speed adoption of 5G standards that will depend heavily on the FCC's approach to the band.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:07 PM | 10 Comments

  • ALB

    Albemarle +2% after beating on earnings, revenues

    • Albemarle (NYSE:ALB) +2.2% after-hours as it reports better than expected Q4 earnings and revenues and issues in-line guidance for 2018.
    • ALB says Q4 net sales in its Lithium and Advanced Materials unit rose 30% Y/Y to $362M, Bromine Specialties net sales gained 12% to $219M, and Refining Solutions net sales rose 23.5% to $238.4M.
    • For FY 2018, ALB forecasts EPS of $5.00-$5.40 vs. $5.14 analyst consensus estimate on revenues of $3.2B-$3.4B vs. $3.23B consensus; the company also sees 2018 EBITDA of $955M-$1.005B.

  • ENPH

    Enphase Energy -3.2% on Q4 beats with rev. drop, in-line guidance

    • Enphase Energy (NASDAQ:ENPH) shares drop 3.2% aftermarket following Q4 results that beat estimates despite a 12% Y/Y revenue drop. 
    • In-line Q1 outlook: Revenue, $65M to $70M (consensus: $66.12M); non-GAAP gross margin, 22% to 25%; non-GAAP operating expense, $17.5M to $18.5M.
    • 2018 goal: The company has a 30-20-10 target by the end of the year, which includes 30% gross margin, 20% operating expenses, and 10% operating income by Q4. 
    • Key metrics: Non-GAAP gross margin, 24.2%; cash and equivalents, $29.1M; inventory, $26M; operating expenses, $21.1M. 
    • The earnings call started at 4:30 PM ET with a webcast available here.
    • Press release     
    • Previously: Enphase Energy beats by $0.02, beats on revenue (Feb. 27)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:52 PM | 3 Comments
  • TIVO

    TiVo +11.8% as it starts to examine strategic alternatives

    • TiVo (NASDAQ:TIVO) posted a revenue beat in Q4 along with announcing it plans to examine strategic alternatives.
    • Shares are up 11.8% after hours.
    • With its stock price below what it thinks is true value, it's begun a process of "evaluating a wide range of strategic alternatives to realize long-term shareholder value" -- which could range from "transformative acquisitions that would accelerate our growth, to combining our business with other leading players, to becoming a private company."
    • Tivo's engaged LionTree Advisors in the evaluation.
    • It's targeting $110M in annual run-rate synergies post-Tivo Solutions acquisition.
    • Income from continuing operations (net of tax) rose to $18.4M from $9.87M; that includes a noncash benefit of $26.6M from the 2017 tax act.
    • Revenue breakout: Licensing, services, software, $206.5M (down 13.4%); Hardware, $7.69M (down 44.5%).
    • The company's not providing guidance for 2018 as it conducts its strategic review.
    • Conference call to come at 5 p.m. ET
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:41 PM | 2 Comments
  • VEEV

    Veeva Systems +4.5% on Q4 beats, upside guidance, 26% subscription growth

    • Veeva Systems (NYSE:VEEV) pops 4.5% aftermarket on Q4 results that beat estimates with 23% revenue growth Y/Y.
    • Upside Q1 guidance has revenue from $188M to $189M (consensus: $187.23M) and EPS from $0.30 to $0.31 (consensus: $0.24). Upside FY19 guidance has revenue from $815M to $820M (consensus: $806.32M) and EPS from $1.30 to $1.33 (consensus: $1.02).
    • Key metrics: Subscription services revenue, $150.9M (+26% Y/Y); cash and equivalents, $320.2M; cash flows from operating activities, $33.7M; total operating expenses, $91.1M. 
    • The earnings call started at 4:30 PM ET with a webcast available here. 
    • Press release       
    • Previously: Veeva Systems beats by $0.02, beats on revenue (Feb. 27)

  • WTW

    Weight Watchers rallies after strong full-year guidance

    • Guidance from Weight Watchers (NYSE:WTW) arrived well-ahead of expectations. The company expects FY18 revenue of $1.55B vs. $1.44B consensus and EPS of $2.40-$2.70 vs. $1.90 consensus.
    • Weight Watchers ended Q4 with 2.0M online subscribers vs. 1.5M a year ago. Total end of period subscribers were 3.2M vs. 2.6M a year ago.
    • CEO update: "We had a highly positive consumer response to the launch of our WW Freestyle program in December, which resulted in a strong finish to the year. More people are engaging with our brand and we ended 2017 with approximately 600,000 more members than a year ago, representing 23% growth... This excellent momentum has continued into 2018."
    • Shares of Weight Watchers are up 4.55% AH to $73.00.
    • Previously: Weight Watchers beats by $0.06, beats on revenue (Feb. 27)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:33 PM | 9 Comments

  • FTR

    Frontier Communications revenue in line; adjustments spur net loss

    • With shares moving largely because of a suspension of its dividend, Frontier Communications (FTR -5.3%) reported a net loss of $1.03B, affected by a pair of extraordinary items.
    • The loss included an $830M tax benefit resulting from new tax legislation, and an after-tax $1.82B goodwill impairment.
    • EBITDA was $919M, beating an expected $915M, with an EBITDA margin of 41.5%.
    • It says it's achieved more than $190M in annualized cost synergies, on track to hit its target of $350M in annualized run-rate cost synergies by the middle of the year.
    • Revenue breakout: Data and Internet services, $939M (down 7.3%); Voice services, $687M (down 11.2%); Video services, $310M (down 15.1%); other, $91M (up 57%); Switched access and subsidy, $190M (down 4.5%).
    • Cash from operations was $665M; adjusted free cash flow came to $228M.
    • For 2018, it's initiating guidance on operating free cash flow -- which it says is more appropriate now that it's completed integrating the former Verizon wireline ops -- of about $800M. It also sees EBITDA of about $3.6B, above consensus for $3.513B, and capital expenditures of $1B-$1.15B.
    • Conference call to come at 4:30 p.m. ET.
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:25 PM | 37 Comments

    Etsy EPS of $0.36

  • ELF

    Weak guidance clips e.l.f. Beauty

    • Shares of e.l.f. Beauty (NYSE:ELF) shed 7% in AH trading after Q4 revenue falls just a tad short of estimates, but full-year guidance misses by a sizable margin.
    • The retailer expects full-year revenue of $286M to $291M vs. $301M consensus.
    • CEO update: "We see meaningful future whitespace ahead, despite continued category headwinds assumed in 2018... We believe we have developed a unique set of capabilities over the last several years that can be leveraged to drive further value in the core e.l.f. business and prospective new brands."
    • Previously: e.l.f. Beauty beats by $0.09, misses on revenue (Feb. 27)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:22 PM
  • WDAY

    Workday -0.8% despite Q4 beats, 34% subscription growth; guidance on call

    • Workday (NYSE:WDAY) drops 0.8% aftermarket despite Q4 results that beat EPS and revenue estimates with a 32.5% revenue growth Y/Y. The company will provide guidance during the earnings call.
    • Key metrics: Subscription revenue, $490M (+33.7% Y/Y); Subscription revenue backlog, $5.2B (+34.4%); operating cash flow (FY18), $465.7M; FCF (FY18), $324.2M; cash and equivalents, $3.3B. 
    • Earnings call is scheduled for 5 PM Eastern Time with a webcast available here.

  • FTR

    Frontier Communications suspends dividend; shares -8%

    • Frontier Communications (NYSE:FTR) is off 8% in early after-hours trading following mostly in-line results for Q4 that also had the board suspending the company's quarterly dividend.
    • That suspension will make another $250M available annually to accelerate debt reduction, the company says.
    • "For 2018, we remain committed to enhancing the customer experience, further improving churn, maintaining strong cash flow, and strengthening the balance sheet as we pursue further stabilization of the business and growth longer term," says CEO Dan McCarthy.
    • Conference call to come at 4:30 p.m. ET.

  • TUSK

    Mammoth Energy +3% as Barclays upgrades

    • Mammoth Energy Services (TUSK +3.1%) is higher after Barclays upgrades shares to Overweight from Equal Weight with a $30 price target, up from $19, praising the company's impressive transformation.
    • The firm says TUSK is punching above its market cap by organically growing its vertically integrated pressure pumping footprint, significantly increasing its sand capacity via acquisitions and upgrades, and quietly expanding into the utility repair and distribution space before becoming the incumbent servicer for PREPA's hurricane restoration efforts in Puerto Rico.
    • TUSK's identity is still evolving, Barclays says, but the prospects appear good as the company plans to participate in the inevitable shift from restoration to reconstruction of the Puerto Rico utilities, shift its pressure pumping footprint and continue to leverage its sand capacity, all while generating free cash flow with a debt free balance sheet.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:56 PM | 4 Comments
  • FRAC

    Keane +4% after easy Q4 earnings, revenue beats

    • Keane Group (FRAC +4%) enjoys strong gains after easily beating Q4 earnings expectations as revenues more than triple, and launching a $100M stock repurchase program.
    • Q4 adjusted EBITDA totaled $93.8M vs. $71.6M million for Q3, and adjusted gross profit was $113.1M compared to $89.7M for Q3.
    • FRAC forecasts Q1 revenues of $530M, slightly better than the $525M analyst consensus estimate, and it expects to remain at full utilization of 26 hydraulic fracturing fleets during the quarter.
    • FRAC says it recently entered into a dedicated agreement with an existing customer for one of the newbuild fleets on order, and expects to deploy the fleet upon delivery by the end of Q2, and remains on schedule for the remaining two of its previously ordered newbuild fleets to be deployed by the end of Q2 and Q3.
    • Also, FRAC's board authorizes a stock buyback program of up to $100M of shares over the next year.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:47 PM | 1 Comment
  • CRI

    Carter's falls after profit guidance disappoints

    • Carter's (NYSE:CRI) is down 10.5% after profit guidance from the retailer arrived short of expectations.
    • Management said EPS growth would be flat to compared to a year ago, implying EPS of $0.97 vs. $1.18 consensus. The full-year profit view is for 15% EPS growth to $6.62 vs. $6.66 consensus.
    • CEO update: "The Tax Cuts and Jobs Act of 2017 is expected to have a significant and positive impact on our Company's future earnings, cash flow, and ability to invest in its growth strategies. In 2018, we plan to reinvest approximately half of the $40 million benefit from the lower corporate tax rate in brand marketing and improved eCommerce capabilities."
    • Today's drop puts Carter's in negative territory for the year (-0.91% YTD).
    • Previously: Carter's beats by $0.12, revenue in-line (Feb. 27)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:36 PM
  • I

    Technology - Top Gainers / Losers as of 2.55 pm (2/27/18)

    • Gainers: I +39%. CASA +12%. ENPH +6%. PI +6%. STRM +5%.
    • Losers: VERI -20%. MOSY -16%. INPX -16%. PNTR -15%. FIT -13%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:55 PM
  • ERII

    Energy Recovery CEO change a positive despite today's plunge, analyst says

    • Energy Recovery (ERII -10.8%) sinks to its lowest level since September following the resignation of CEO Joel Gay, but B. Riley analyst Thomas Curran thinks the change will prove a net positive for the company.
    • Gay had sustained "significant reputation damage" due to how he managed the VorTeq initiative, the analyst says, also noting that Gay resigned "entirely for personal reasons" and that his reasons have nothing to do with the company's fundamentals.
    • Curran says ERII shares offer a compelling risk/reward and he is a buyer on today's selloff, maintaining his Buy rating and $20 price target.
    • Source: Bloomberg First Word
     
     
     
     
    | 2:24 PM | 12 Comments
  • AAPL

    Apple roundup: Ireland must collect back taxes, new series, and potential new hire

    • The European Commission says it will only withdraw a complaint against Ireland if the country fully recovers the $16B in back taxes from Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL).
    • The EU took Ireland to court last October due to a slow recovery process. 
    • Last week, Ireland said it was finishing calculations on how much to collect and that those calculations would be finished before the end of April. 
    • New series: Variety reports that M. Night Shyamalan will produce a thriller for Apple. 
    • The straight-to-series, half-hour show has a 10pepisode order and Shyamalan scheduled to direct the first episode. 
    • In a $1B original content push, Apple current projects include a drama series starring Jennifer Anniston and Reese Witherspoon, a reboot of Steven Spielberg’s “Amazing Stories”, and an anthology series from Kumail Nanjiana and Emily V. Gordon. 
    • New hire: French site MacG says Apple has hired Michael Abbott, former VP of engineering at Twitter, GM at Microsoft, and head of Palm’s webOS. No confirmation from Apple or Abbott. 
    • Apple shares are up 0.2%.  
    • Previously: Apple is launching medical clinics (Feb. 27)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:18 PM | 18 Comments
  • JPM

    Record profits expected at JPMorgan in 2018 amid higher interest rates

    • JPMorgan (JPM -0.5%) expects to see its profit rise to the highest level ever as a result of the recent tax cuts, and gradual hikes in interest rates.
    • According to its investor day presentation, the bank says interest and fees income will jump to $55B in 2018, and total pre-tax income will be $47B up from $40B in 2017.
    • Ken Udin an analyst at Jeffries says this forecast puts net income in the $33B to $36B range, up from $27B over the 12 months ended in September.
    • The head of investment banking, Daniel Pinto says a spike in volatility has helped the bank with trading revenue on pace to increase by “mid to high single digits” in Q1 of 2018.
    • In other news Jamie Dimon says he’ll call the governor of whichever state Amazon picks for its 2nd headquarters and try to get the same tax benefits for JPMorgan's new tower in New York.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:16 PM | 16 Comments
  • FOX

    Fox: Sticking with Sky bid as Comcast hasn't made firm offer

  • MSFT

    Supreme Court seems split on Microsoft data case

    • The Supreme Court begins discussing the U.S. v. Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT) whether U.S. warrants can access tech company data stored entirely overseas.
    • Conservative Justices John Roberts and Samuel Alito seemed to side with the Department of Justice with Alito saying ‘it is a little difficult to see what Ireland’s interest is” when the warrant involves an American company with an American citizen’s emails related to crimes committed in America. 
    • Justices Ruth Bader Ginsburg and Sonia Sotomayor side with Microsoft and the tech industry in thinking Congress should write a new law rather than relying on a law written three decades ago. 
    • Alito: “It would be good if Congress enacted legislation that would modernize this, but in the meantime something has to happen.” 
    • The Court decision is expected before the end of June. 
    • Microsoft shares are down 0.4%.         
    • Previously: Microsoft privacy case heads to Supreme Court (Feb. 27)

    • At Mobile World Congress, T-Mobile (TMUS -0.8%) is outlining how it doesn't expect to get left behind in the race to 5G -- saying it's building out in 30 cities and that when 5G-capable smartphones are rolled out next year, customers in Dallas will be among the the first to experience it.

    • Nokia (NOK +0.3%) is helping to build out T-Mobile's network starting in Q2 with deployment scheduled to wrap in 2020. The 5G radio access network will be deployed by the end of the year using 600 MHz and mmWave AirScale solutions.

  • BASFY

    BASF -3% as basic chemicals seen slumping in 2018

    • BASF (OTCQX:BASFY -3.4%) is sharply lower despite reporting Q4 net profit more than doubled Y/Y to €1.54B ($1.9B) from €689M a year earlier, due in part to higher sales volumes across most of its units and higher prices for its chemical products.
    • Calling Q4 results "a good start" heading into 2018, BASF says Q4 sales totaled €16.1B, up 8% Y/Y, and sales volumes rose 4%, driven by all segments except oil and gas; negative currency effects were significantly higher and reduced sales by 5%.
    • BASF says its basic chemicals unit saw EBIT adjusted for one-off items surge by 67% in Q4 but expects adjusted EBIT at the unit to fall 11% or more in 2018.
    • For 2018, BASF expects the global economy and chemical production to grow at roughly the same pace as in 2017, with growth expected in all regions amid a recovery underway in Brazil and Russia, but the company also sees increased market volatility and a further negative impact on sales and earnings from the U.S. dollar.
    • BASF also proposes a dividend of €3.10/share vs. €3.00 for 2016.

  • Yields up, and stocks down as Powell says outlook "strengthened"

    • Fed Chair Jay Powell presents the Fed's semi-annual report to Congress in his 1st public appearance since becoming chairman.
    • When asked about changes in his economic outlook since December, he swiftly answered by saying his own outlook has "strengthened."
    • In another question regarding Fed policy tools, Powell says IOER to remain primary driver in setting the Fed Funds rate in the near-term.
    • He also says all of the Fed's holdings of mortgage-backed securities to roll-off, as indicated in earlier statements, but he says the Fed will not sell outright securities at this point.

  • AMT

    American Tower -2% as it looks ahead to challenge of India service

    • American Tower (NYSE:AMT) is 2% lower this morning after Q4 earnings beat expectations but contained some full-year guidance for income and funds from operations below Street expectations.
    • Revenues in Q4 grew by 11% and tenant billings by 8.6%; net income fell by 16%, to $195M.
    • Adjusted FFO available to shareholders, meanwhile, rose by 9% to $688M.
    • Long-term objectives for rapid growth exceeded expectations: The company hit 150,000 sites vs. a goal of 100,000.
    • "As we look forward to 2018, we expect strong organic tenant billings growth of over 6% in the U.S., driven by unlimited data plans, increasing mobile video consumption, announced spectrum build-outs in the 2.5 GHz and 600 MHz bands and the planned FirstNet deployment," says CEO Jim Taiclet. "We also expect consistent demand for tower space in Latin America, notably in Mexico and Brazil, as well as robust activity in our key markets in the EMEA region."
    • India carrier consolidation was incorporated into guidance, and Taiclet says once activity concludes, India will be positioned for major investments for 4G service. On Nov. 13 it entered deals with Vodafone India and Idea Cellular to buy about 20,000 sites for around $1.2B.
    • Cash from operations rose nearly 10% to $794M; free cash flow rose 7% to $548M.
    • For 2018, it's guiding to total property revenue of $6.93B-$7.12B (7% growth at the midpoint); net income of $1.39B-$1.47B (16.7% growth, but below consensus for $1.59B); EBITDA of $4.3B-$4.4B (6.4% growth and above expected $4.26B); and adjusted FFO of $3.16B-$3.26B (10.6% growth), below expectations for $3.347B.
